page.title: 02HOUSING IN THE VILLAGES.
page.content: Most of the houses in this area are privately owned, but a small row of council houses has been built in each of the three villages. There are also fourteen farms. Some of the houses in Croft were built in the nineteenth century as boarding houses for people coming to take the spa waters, although there has been more recent development in all the villages. In Dalton on Tees there are two small new private estates being built, providing fifteen new houses. In Hurworth Place a warden controlled unit for elderly people has been built, where the residents have their own room, and there are community rooms as well. In Croft on Tees eight bungalows for the elderly were built in 1983.
